idea.title: PetCare AI — Vet Bill Fairness Checker
idea.summary: Same as yesterday (site hasn't refreshed yet). OCR-powered app to verify vet bill fairness. Upload receipt, match against regional pricing database, get instant verdict. $5/mo subscription, API licensing to pet insurers. Market: 67% US households own pets, $35B annual vet spend.
idea.healthcareAngle: Pattern remains instructive: high-stakes billing opacity + AI-powered transparency = consumer demand. The same thesis applies to clinical AI governance. Pet owners want pricing verdicts; hospital boards want decision assurance verdicts. LUMEN SDK is the enterprise-grade clinical version of this transparency play.
idea.verdictNote: B2C consumer pet market — not in your wheelhouse. But validates the 'governance as transparency' thesis you're building for healthcare.

articles.title: Preparing Hospitals for Large-Scale AI Deployments in 2026
articles.takeaway: Mayo Clinic leads with 50+ AI patents and $3.20 ROI per dollar invested in 14 months. Key deployment areas: clinical decision support, diagnostics prioritization, ambient scribes (99% transcription accuracy), predictive deterioration alerts. Infrastructure challenges: FHIR/HL7 for data silos, APIs for legacy EHRs. Best practice: assess 8 pillars (strategy, data, ethics, workforce, etc.) before scaling. The '8 pillars' framework aligns perfectly with LUMEN SDK's multi-criteria scoring approach.
articles.linkedinAngle: Mayo Clinic sees $3.20 return for every $1 invested in healthcare AI. But 8 pillars must be assessed before scaling: strategy, data readiness, ethics, workforce, infrastructure, governance, vendor partnerships, and patient consent. How many hospitals have systematically evaluated all 8?

articles.title: Health Care AI in 2026: Governance and Trust Take Center Stage
articles.takeaway: URAC offers accreditation for ethical AI deployment — signaling that governance frameworks are becoming mandatory table stakes, not optional differentiators. 95% of AI-adopting organizations have governance processes; 99% face scaling barriers. The gap between policy and runtime enforcement is the billion-dollar opportunity. LUMEN SDK addresses this exact gap.
articles.linkedinAngle: 95% of healthcare AI adopters have governance policies. 99% can't scale them. The gap isn't paperwork — it's runtime enforcement. Policies don't stop bad AI decisions at 3am. Decision assurance infrastructure does.

articles.title: 2026 Healthcare's Pivotal Year for AI Transformation
articles.takeaway: Implementation bottleneck is now the primary constraint — not innovation. Direct-to-consumer AI (OpenAI, Google) may bypass traditional hospital oversight entirely, creating shadow AI risk. Organizations treating governance as 'compliance theater' will face incidents and public outcry. Warning: without robust runtime governance, AI will amplify errors and bias. This is the exact risk LUMEN SDK mitigates.
articles.linkedinAngle: 2026 is healthcare AI's 'prove it or move aside' year. The bottleneck shifted from innovation to implementation. Organizations treating governance as compliance theater will learn the hard way. Those building genuine runtime assurance will scale safely.

linkedin.author: Dr. Zafar Chaudry
linkedin.insight: Jan 2026 post: 'Leading clinical AI governance framework for 2026 deployments... ensuring ethical AI in diagnostics and workflows.' Active on ethics panels, pushing for standardized governance across health systems. The CMIO role is becoming synonymous with AI governance ownership.

linkedin.author: Michael E. Davis
linkedin.insight: Jan 2026: Shared whitepaper on 'Healthcare AI governance playbook: Focus on clinical AI risk management entering 2026.' Emphasis on risk tiers: administrative AI (low oversight), triage (semi-autonomous), clinical decisions (highest trust standards). The tiered approach validates LUMEN SDK's multi-criteria scoring model.

events.name: ViVE 2026
events.description: 16 days away. 9,000+ attendees, 2,000+ C-level execs, 800+ sponsors. Co-created by HLTH and CHIME. Focus: AI integration, cybersecurity, interoperability. CHIME CIO Boot Camp Feb 19-21 right before. The premier venue for positioning LUMEN SDK with decision-makers. Early pricing closes soon.

events.name: HIMSS26 Global Health Conference
events.description: 31 days away. 30,000+ attendees. Largest health IT event globally. AI governance track, CHAI presence, clinical decision support sessions. LUMEN SDK's natural home stage. Executive Summit runs Mar 9-12 for C-level networking.

events.name: CHIME Healthcare CIO Boot Camp
events.description: Intimate CIO-focused training right before ViVE. Perfect for relationship-building with target CIO personas before the main conference chaos.

events.name: Becker's Health IT + RCM Annual Meeting
events.description: Strong CIO/CFO attendance. Revenue cycle + AI governance intersection. SDK pitch to leaders managing both clinical and financial risk.

videos.title: Clinical AI Governance: What Clinicians Must Know in 2026
videos.description: Panel covers: FDA clearance vs. approval distinctions, managing model drift in production, liability implications (clinicians remain accountable), establishing governance councils, and why institutions — not just regulators — must invest in ongoing clinical impact assessment. The 'institutions must own governance' message is the exact positioning for LUMEN SDK.

quote.text: An entrepreneur is someone who jumps off a cliff and builds a plane on the way down.
quote.author: Reid Hoffman
quote.reflection: Sean — you jumped off the Microsoft cliff in June 2025. Eight months later, you've built LUMEN, positioned the SDK thesis, and you're reviewing SickKids' AI budget as a trusted advisor. The plane is taking shape mid-flight. Today you're on Rose Island snorkelling with the family — the perfect metaphor for flying while building. The water's warm, the stakes are high, and the view from up here is starting to look pretty good. ViVE is 16 days out. The runway is approaching. Enjoy the Bahamas.
